English Sentences: And they also, if they abide not still in unbelief, shall be graffed in: for God is able to graff them in again.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aihudatikka qassi ammanennan ixxiyoogaa aggikko, Xoossai kase eti de7iyoosan zaaridi wottana; aissi giikko, i eta zaaridi wottanau danddayees.

English Sentences: For if thou wert cut out of the olive tree which is wild by nature, and wert graffed contrary to nature into a good olive tree: how much more shall these, which be the natural branches, be graffed into their own olive tree?
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, Xoossai nena woran de7iya wogaraappe qanxxidi, ne meretaadan gidennan gaden tookkido wogaraara gatti qachchidabaa gidikko, yaatin, he karetti wodhdhida tasheta zaarettidi, eta anuwaara gatti qachchanau, a aibi waissanee?

English Sentences: For I would not, brethren, that ye should be ignorant of this mystery, lest ye should be wise in your own conceits; that blindness in part is happened to Israel, until the fulness of the Gentiles be come in.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta ishatoo, taani intte eranaadan koyiyo tumu xuura yohoi de7ees; hegee intte inttena intterkka, nuuni aadhdhida eranchcha yaagidi qoppiyoogaa teqqees; Israa7eela asaappe baggai siyennan ixxiis; shin he siyennan ixxiyoogee Aihuda gidenna asaa kumetta qoodai Xoossaakko gakkanaassi gam77ana.

English Sentences: And so all Israel shall be saved: as it is written, There shall come out of Sion the Deliverer, and shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob:
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadankka, Israa7eela asai ubbai attana; Xoossaa maxaafai hagaadan yaagees; "Ashshiyaagee Xiyoone giyo katamaappe yaana; yiidi, nagara ooso ubbaa Yaaqooba zariyaappe diggana.

English Sentences: For this is my covenant unto them, when I shall take away their sins.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani eta nagaraa atto yaagiyo wode, etaara maacettana maachchai hagaa" yaagees.

English Sentences: As concerning the gospel, they are enemies for your sakes: but as touching the election, they are beloved for the fathers' sakes.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aihuda gidenna asatoo, Aihudati wonggeliyaa mishiraachchuwaa baggaara intte gishshau, Xoossaara morkke; shin Xoossaa dooruwaa baggaara aawatu gishshau, eti i siiqiyoogeeta.

English Sentences: For the gifts and calling of God are without repentance.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, Xoossai ba immidoogaa guyye ekkenna; qassi ba dooridoogaa ixxaas geenna.

English Sentences: For as ye in times past have not believed God, yet have now obtained mercy through their unbelief:
Wolaitta Sentences: Aihuda gidennaageetoo, Xoossau intte kase azazettibeekketa; shin Aihudati azazettennan ixxido gishshau, Xoossaa maarotettaa ha77i intte ekkideta.

English Sentences: Even so have these also now not believed, that through your mercy they also may obtain mercy.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadan, intte ekkido maarotettaa gishshau, Aihudati qassi Xoossaa maarotettaa ha77i ekkanaadan, Xoossau azazettennan ixxidosona.

English Sentences: For God hath concluded them all in unbelief, that he might have mercy upon all.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, Xoossai asa ubbaa maarana mala, asai ubbai ayyo azazettennan ixxiyo hanotan qachchiis.

English Sentences: O the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God! how unsearchable are his judgments, and his ways past finding out!
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa duretettai ai keena daroo? A hayyoinne a eratettai ai keena xoqqee? A pirddaa yootanai oonee? I ba oottiyoogaa aissi oottiyaakko, oonee akeekiyai?

English Sentences: For who hath known the mind of the Lord? or who hath been his counsellor?
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa Xoossaa maxaafai, "Godaa wozanaa eriyai oonee? A zoranau danddayiyai oonee?

English Sentences: Or who hath first given to him, and it shall be recompensed unto him again?
Wolaitta Sentences: Woikko ba kushiyaa zaarana mala, au aibakko immidai de7ii?" yaagees.

English Sentences: For of him, and through him, and to him, are all things: to whom be glory for ever. Amen.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, ubbabaa i medhdhiis; qassi ubbabaikka aaninne ayyoonne de7ees; Xoossau merinau bonchchoi gido. Amin77i.

English Sentences: I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, that ye present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable unto God, which is your reasonable service.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, ta ishatoo, intte intte asatettaa Xoossaa ufaissiya de7onne geeshsha yarshsho oottidi, Xoossau shiishshanaadan, taani inttena Xoossaa maarotettan woossais; Xoossau intte goinnanau bessiya tumu ogee hegaa.

English Sentences: And be not conformed to this world: but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind, that ye may prove what is that good, and acceptable, and perfect, will of God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai intte qofaa muumeera dummayidi, inttena laammoppe attin, ha sa7aa asaa milatoppite. He wode intte Xoossai koyiyoobi, lo77obi, a ufaissiyaabinne qassi kumettabi aibakko erana.

English Sentences: For I say, through the grace given unto me, to every man that is among you, not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think; but to think soberly, according as God hath dealt to every man the measure of faith.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai tau immido aaro kehatettan taani intteyyo yootais. Intte qoppanau bessiyaagaappe aattidi, otoruwan qoppoppite; hegaa aggidi, wozannaama asadan qoppite; Xoossai intteyyo huuphiyan huuphiyan immido ammanuwaa keenan intte bolli pirddite.

English Sentences: For as we have many members in one body, and all members have not the same office:
Wolaitta Sentences: Nu issi bollaa giddon, daro bollaa qommoti de7oosona; he qommotu ubbaukka dumma dumma oosoi de7ees.

English Sentences: So we, being many, are one body in Christ, and every one members one of another.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadan, nuuni daro asa gidikkokka, Kiristtoosa baggaara issi asa. Qassi nuuni issi asatettaa qommotudan, issoi issuwaara oiqetti uttida.

English Sentences: Having then gifts differing according to the grace that is given to us, whether prophecy, let us prophesy according to the proportion of faith;
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai nuuyyo immido aaro kehatettan dumma dumma imoi de7ees. Nu imoi Xoossaa qaalaa yootiyoobaa gidikko, nuuyyo de7iya ammanuwaa keenaa yotanau bessees.

English Sentences: Or ministry, let us wait on our ministering: or he that teacheth, on teaching;
Wolaitta Sentences: Oottiyoobaa gidikko, he oosuwan minnanau bessees; tamaarissiyoobaa gidikko, he tamaarissuwan minnanau bessees.

English Sentences: Or he that exhorteth, on exhortation: he that giveth, let him do it with simplicity; he that ruleth, with diligence; he that sheweth mercy, with cheerfulness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Harata minttettiyoobaa gidikko, he aani minnanau bessees. Bau de7iyaabaappe haratuyyo immiya ooninne wozanappe immo. Maati de7iyo urai mintti oottanau bessees; haratuyyo kehiya urai ufaissan kehanau bessees.

English Sentences: Let love be without dissimulation. Abhor that which is evil; cleave to that which is good.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte siiqoi asa bessanau siiqettiyoobaa gidanau bessenna. Iitabaa ixxite; lo77obaa minttidi oiqqite.

English Sentences: Be kindly affectioned one to another with brotherly love; in honour preferring one another;
Wolaitta Sentences: Issoi issuwaara ishanttudan siiqettite; issoi issuwaa bonchchiyoogan ufaittite.

English Sentences: Not slothful in business; fervent in spirit; serving the Lord;
Wolaitta Sentences: Minni oottite; azalloppite; intte kumetta wozanaappe Godau oottite.

English Sentences: Rejoicing in hope; patient in tribulation; continuing instant in prayer;
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai intteyyo immana giidoogan ufaittite; waayiyan genccite. Ubba wode Xoossaa woossite;

English Sentences: Distributing to the necessity of saints; given to hospitality.
Wolaitta Sentences: geeshshata koshshiyaaban maaddite; imattaa mokkite.

English Sentences: Bless them which persecute you: bless, and curse not.
Wolaitta Sentences: Inttena yedettiyaageeta anjjite; eta anjjanaappe attin, qanggoppite.

English Sentences: Rejoice with them that do rejoice, and weep with them that weep.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ufaittiyaageetuura ufaittite; yeekkiyaageetuurakka yeekkite.

English Sentences: Be of the same mind one toward another. Mind not high things, but condescend to men of low estate. Be not wise in your own conceits.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asa ubbau issi mala qofaa qoppite; oottiyooban ubban inttena toochchidi de7iteppe attin, otorettoppite; inttena intte huuphen aadhdhida eranchcha giidi qoppoppite.

English Sentences: Recompense to no man evil for evil. Provide things honest in the sight of all men.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ooninne intteyyo iitabaa oottikko, he urau iitabaa ootti zaaroppite; asa ubbau lo77obaa oottanau qoppite.

English Sentences: If it be possible, as much as lieth in you, live peaceably with all men.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asa ubbaara sarotettan de7anau, intte baggaara, intteyyo danddayettidabaa ubbaa oottite.

English Sentences: Dearly beloved, avenge not yourselves, but rather give place unto wrath: for it is written, Vengeance is mine; I will repay, saith the Lord.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta ishatoo, intte intte huuphen asau halo kessoppite. Xoossai haluwaa kessanau, a aggiigite. Aissi giikko, Xoossaa maxaafai, "Godai, Taani haluwaa kessana; taani kushiyaa zaarana yaagees" yaagees.

English Sentences: Therefore if thine enemy hunger, feed him; if he thirst, give him drink: for in so doing thou shalt heap coals of fire on his head.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Xoossaa maxaafai, "Ne morkkee namisettikko, miza. Saamettikko, ushsha. Aissi giikko, neeni hegaa oottiyoogan a huuphiyan tamaa bonqquwaa qolana" yaagees.

English Sentences: Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iitabaa lo77oban xoonappe attin, iitabai nena xoonoppo.

English Sentences: Let every soul be subject unto the higher powers. For there is no power but of God: the powers that be are ordained of God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asai ubbai deriyaa heemmiyaageetuyyo haarettanau bessees; aissi giikko, Xoossai geennan de7ishin, dere heemmiyaabi de7anau danddayenna. Ha77i de7iya heemmiyaageetikka Xoossai wottidoogeeta.

English Sentences: Whosoever therefore resisteth the power, resisteth the ordinance of God: and they that resist shall receive to themselves damnation.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, ha77i de7iya heemmiyaageeta ixxiya ooninne Xoossaa azazuwaa ixxees; ixxiya ooninne ba bolli pirddaa ehees.

English Sentences: For rulers are not a terror to good works, but to the evil. Wilt thou then not be afraid of the power? do that which is good, and thou shalt have praise of the same:
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, heemmiyaageeti iitabaa oottiyaageeta yashshiyoogaappe attin, lo77obaa oottiyaageeta yashshokkona. Heemmiyaagaayyo yayyennan agganau koyai? Yaatikko lo77obaa ootta; i nena galatana.

English Sentences: For he is the minister of God to thee for good. But if thou do that which is evil, be afraid; for he beareth not the sword in vain: for he is the minister of God, a revenger to execute wrath upon him that doeth evil.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, i neeyyo lo77obaa oottanau, Xoossau ashkkara. SHin neeni iitabaa oottikko, iitabaa oottidaagaa i seeriyo gishshau, ayyo yayya; i Xoossaa ashkkara. Qassi iitabaa oottiyaageetu bolli Xoossaa hanqquwaa i ehees.

English Sentences: Wherefore ye must needs be subject, not only for wrath, but also for conscience sake.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, deriyaa heemmiyaageetuyyo azazettiyoogee Xoossaa hanqquwaa xalaalaassa gidennan, inttena zoriya wozanaa gishshaukka haarettanau bessees.

English Sentences: For for this cause pay ye tribute also: for they are God's ministers, attending continually upon this very thing.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, deriyaa heemmiyaageeti bantta oosuwaa oottiyo wode, Xoossau oottiyo gishshau, intte giiraa giiriyoogee hegaassa.

English Sentences: Render therefore to all their dues: tribute to whom tribute is due; custom to whom custom; fear to whom fear; honour to whom honour.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ubbau bessiyaagaa immite. Giiraa giiranau bessiyoogau giirite; qaraxaa qanxxanau bessiyoogau qanxxite; yayyanau bessiyoogau yayyite; bonchchoi bessiyoogaa bonchchite.

English Sentences: Owe no man any thing, but to love one another: for he that loveth another hath fulfilled the law.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte issoi issuwaara siiqettanaappe attin, o acoinne intte bolli de7oppo. Aissi giikko, ba shooruwaa siiqiya ooninne higgee giyoogaa poliis.

English Sentences: For this, Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not kill, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not bear false witness, Thou shalt not covet; and if there be any other commandment, it is briefly comprehended in this saying, namely, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.
Wolaitta Sentences: "SHaaramuxoppa; woroppa; wuuqqoppa; asabaa amottoppa" giya azazotinne hara azazo ubbati, "Ne shooruwaa ne huuphedan siiqa" giya azazuwan kuuyettoosona.

English Sentences: Love worketh no ill to his neighbour: therefore love is the fulfilling of the law.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba shooruwaa siiqiya ooninne ayyo iitabaa oottenna; hegaa gishshau, shooruwaa siiqiyoogee higge ubbau azazettiyoogaa.

English Sentences: And that, knowing the time, that now it is high time to awake out of sleep: for now is our salvation nearer than when we believed.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xiskkuwaappe intte beegottiyo saatee ha77i gakkido gishshau, ha wodiyaa akeekite. Aissi giikko, nuuni koiro ammaniyo wodeppe, nuuni attiyo wodee ha77i nuukko matattiis.

English Sentences: The night is far spent, the day is at hand: let us therefore cast off the works of darkness, and let us put on the armour of light.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qammai aadhdhanau hanees; gallassai matattiis. Simmi nuuni xumaa oosuwaa aggidi, poo7uwan olettanau, tooraa gonddalliyaa oiqqoos;

English Sentences: Let us walk honestly, as in the day; not in rioting and drunkenness, not in chambering and wantonness, not in strife and envying.
Wolaitta Sentences: gallassi poo7uwan de7iya asadan, ane maara de7oos. Yettaaninne mattuwan gidoppo; shaaramuxiyoogaaninne shaaramuxanau qaaqqatiyoogan gidoppo; palamaaninne qanaatiyan gidoppo.

English Sentences: But put ye on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make not provision for the flesh, to fulfil the lusts thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Godaa Yesuus Kiristtoosa tooraa gonddalliyaa oiqqite; intte nagaranchcha asatettai ba wozanaa amuwaa polanaadan, au qoppoppite.

English Sentences: Him that is weak in the faith receive ye, but not to doubtful disputations.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ammanuwan azalliya uraa shiishshi ekkite. SHin i ba huuphen qoppiyooban aara palamettoppite.

English Sentences: For one believeth that he may eat all things: another, who is weak, eateth herbs.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi ura ammanoi i ai miininne diggenna. SHin ammanuwan azalliya urai gaden mokkidabaa xalaalaa mees.

English Sentences: Let not him that eateth despise him that eateth not; and let not him which eateth not judge him that eateth: for God hath received him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ubbabaa miya urai ubbabaa meenna uraa karoppo; ubbabaa meenna uraikka ubbabaa miya uraa bolli pirddoppo. Aissi giikko, Xoossai a shiishshi ekkiis.

English Sentences: Who art thou that judgest another man's servant? to his own master he standeth or falleth. Yea, he shall be holden up: for God is able to make him stand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hara asa ashkkaraa bolli pirddiyaagee neeni oonee? I kunddin woi denddin ba godaassa; shin Godai a denttanau danddayiyo gishshau, i eqqana.

English Sentences: One man esteemeth one day above another: another esteemeth every day alike. Let every man be fully persuaded in his own mind.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi urai, "Hiqqa gallassai hara gallassatuppe aadhdhees" yaagidi qoppiyo wode, harai, "Ubba gallassatikka issi mala" giidi qoppees. Asai ubbai huuphiyan huuphiyan hegaadan aissi qoppiyaakko akeeko.

English Sentences: He that regardeth the day, regardeth it unto the Lord; and he that regardeth not the day, to the Lord he doth not regard it. He that eateth, eateth to the Lord, for he giveth God thanks; and he that eateth not, to the Lord he eateth not, and giveth God thanks.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi gallassaa hara gallassatuppe aattidi bonchchiya urai Godaa bonchchuwau bonchchees; quma miya uraikka Godaa bonchchuwau mees. Aissi giikko, i he qumaa gishshau, Xoossaa galatees. Qumaa meennaageekka Godaa bonchchuwau meennan aggees; qassi Xoossaa galatees.

English Sentences: For none of us liveth to himself, and no man dieth to himself.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, nuuppe ooninne ba huuphe xalaalau de7enna; qassi ooninne ba huuphe xalaalau haiqqenna.

English Sentences: For whether we live, we live unto the Lord; and whether we die, we die unto the Lord: whether we live therefore, or die, we are the Lord's.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni paxa de7ikko, Godau de7oos; qassi haiqqikkokka, Godau haiqqoos. Simmi nuuni paxa de7in woi haiqqin Godaassa.

English Sentences: For to this end Christ both died, and rose, and revived, that he might be Lord both of the dead and living.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Kiristtoosi paxa de7iyaageetuyyoonne haiqqidaageetuyyo Goda gidanau haiqqidi, haiquwaappe denddiis.

English Sentences: But why dost thou judge thy brother? or why dost thou set at nought thy brother? for we shall all stand before the judgment seat of Christ.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatin, neeni ne ishaa bolli aissi pirddai? Woikko neeni ne ishaa aissi karai? Nuuni ubbaikka Xoossaa pirddaa araataa sinttan eqqana.

English Sentences: For it is written, As I live, saith the Lord, every knee shall bow to me, and every tongue shall confess to God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, Xoossaa maxaafai, "Taani Godai ta de7uwan caaqqais; asai ubbai ta sinttan gulbbatana. Qassi taani Xoossaa gidiyoogaa asai ubbai markkattana yaagais" yaagees.

English Sentences: So then every one of us shall give account of himself to God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Simmi nuuni huuphiyan huuphiyan nubaa Xoossau yootana.

English Sentences: Let us not therefore judge one another any more: but judge this rather, that no man put a stumblingblock or an occasion to fall in his brother's way.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, nuuni issoi issuwaa bolli pirddiyoogaa hagaappe sinttau ane aggoos. SHin ubbaappe aattidi, intte ishaa xubbiyaabaa woikko nagaran onggiyaabaa oottennaadan qofaa qachchite.

English Sentences: I know, and am persuaded by the Lord Jesus, that there is nothing unclean of itself: but to him that esteemeth any thing to be unclean, to him it is unclean.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani Godaa Yesuus Kiristtoosaara de7iyoogan, ba huuphen tuna gididabi bainnaagaa eraisinne akeekais. SHin issi urai issibaa tuna giidi qoppikko, hegee au tuna gidees.

English Sentences: But if thy brother be grieved with thy meat, now walkest thou not charitably. Destroy not him with thy meat, for whom Christ died.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni miyoobaa gishshau, ne ishaa qohikko, simmi neeni siiquwan de7akka. Kiristtoosi a gishshau haiqqido asa ne miyo quman bashshoppa.

English Sentences: Let not then your good be evil spoken of:
Wolaitta Sentences: Simmi neeni lo77obaa giyoobaa asi cayoppo.

English Sentences: For the kingdom of God is not meat and drink; but righteousness, and peace, and joy in the Holy Ghost.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, Xoossaa kawotettai Geeshsha Ayyaanai immiyo xillotetta, sarotettanne ufaissa gidiyoogaappe attin, muussanne ushsha gidenna.

English Sentences: For he that in these things serveth Christ is acceptable to God, and approved of men.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, Kiristtoosayyo hagaadan oottiya urai ooninne Xoossaa ufaissees; asaikka a galatees.

English Sentences: Let us therefore follow after the things which make for peace, and things wherewith one may edify another.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatikko, ane nuuni sarotetta ehiyaabaanne nuna issuwaa issuwaara minttettiyaabaa ubbaa koyoos.

English Sentences: For meat destroy not the work of God. All things indeed are pure; but it is evil for that man who eateth with offence.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa oosuwaa quma gishshau bashshoppa. Quma ubbaa min aikko baawa; shin hara ura nagaran yeggiyaabaa miya urau iita.

English Sentences: It is good neither to eat flesh, nor to drink wine, nor any thing whereby thy brother stumbleth, or is offended, or is made weak.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asho meennan woi ushsha uyennan aggiyoogee woikko ne ishaa xubbiyaabaa aibanne oottennan aggiyoogee lo77o.

English Sentences: Hast thou faith? have it to thyself before God. Happy is he that condemneth not himself in that thing which he alloweth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha yohuwan neeni ammaniyoobaa neeppenne Xoossaappe gidduwan naaga. Issi urai lo77o giidi ba qoppidobaa oottiyo wode, "Taani mooraas" geennan aggikko, he urai tumu anjjettidaagaa.

English Sentences: And he that doubteth is damned if he eat, because he eateth not of faith: for whatsoever is not of faith is sin.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin i ba miyoobaa sirikko, a meettai ammanuwaana gidenna gishshau, Xoossai a bolli pirddiis; qassi ammanoi bainnan oottidobi aibinne nagara.

English Sentences: We then that are strong ought to bear the infirmities of the weak, and not to please ourselves.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni ammanuwan minnidaageeti daafuranchchatu toohuwaa tookkanau bessees; nuuni nu xalaalaa ufaissanau bessenna.

English Sentences: Let every one of us please his neighbour for his good to edification.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni huuphiyan huuphiyan nu ishaa maaddanau, ammanuwan a minttanaunne ufaissanau bessees.

English Sentences: For even Christ pleased not himself; but, as it is written, The reproaches of them that reproached thee fell on me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, harai atto Kiristtoosikka bana ufaissibeenna. SHin Xoossaa maxaafai, "Nena boridaageeti borido boree ta bolli wodhdhiis" giidoogaadan haniis.

English Sentences: For whatsoever things were written aforetime were written for our learning, that we through patience and comfort of the scriptures might have hope.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa maxaafai nuuyyo immiyo genccaaninne minttettuwan nuuni demmana giidi ufaissan naagi uttidoogee de7ana mala, Xoossaa maxaafan xaafettida ubbabai nuna tamaarissanau xaafettiis.

English Sentences: Now the God of patience and consolation grant you to be likeminded one toward another according to Christ Jesus:
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte ubbai issi wozana gididi, issi qaalan Xoossaa, nu Godaa Yesuus Kiristtoosa Aawaa, bonchchana mala, genccaanne minotettaa immiya Xoossai, intteyyo Kiristtoos Yesuusi oottidoogaadan,

English Sentences: That ye may with one mind and one mouth glorify God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
Wolaitta Sentences: issoi issuwaara issippe de7iyo issi qofaa immo.

English Sentences: Wherefore receive ye one another, as Christ also received us to the glory of God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Kiristtoosi inttena mokkidoogaadan, Xoossaa bonchchuwau issoi issuwaa mokkite.

English Sentences: Now I say that Jesus Christ was a minister of the circumcision for the truth of God, to confirm the promises made unto the fathers:
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, Xoossai ammanettidaagaa gidiyoogaa erissanau, Xoossai aawatuyyo immana giidoogaa tumayanaunne Aihuda gidenna asai Xoossaa a maarotettaa gishshau bonchchanau Kiristtoosi Aihudatuyyo ashkkara gididoogaa intteyyo odais.

English Sentences: And that the Gentiles might glorify God for his mercy; as it is written, For this cause I will confess to thee among the Gentiles, and sing unto thy name.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa Xoossaa maxaafai yaagees; "Hegaa gishshau, taani nena Aihuda gidenna asaa giddon galatana; ne sunttaakka sabbana" yaagees.

English Sentences: And again he saith, Rejoice, ye Gentiles, with his people.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassikka, "Aihuda gidenna asatoo, Xoossaa asatuura ufaittite" yaagees.

English Sentences: And again, Praise the Lord, all ye Gentiles; and laud him, all ye people.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassikka gujjidi, "Inttenoo, Aihuda gidenna asatoo ubbau, Godaa galatite; asau ubbau, a galatite" yaagees.

English Sentences: And again, Esaias saith, There shall be a root of Jesse, and he that shall rise to reign over the Gentiles; in him shall the Gentiles trust.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassikka Isiyaasi, "Isseya zaree yaana; yiidi Aihuda gidenna asaa haaranau denddana. Qassi eti a baggaara demmana giidi ufaissan naagana" yaagees.

English Sentences: Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that ye may abound in hope, through the power of the Holy Ghost.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte ekkana giidi ufaissan naagiyoogee Geeshsha Ayyaanaa wolqqan diccanaadan, intteyyo immana giida Xoossai, intte a ammaniyo gishshau, intteyyo ufaissaanne sarotettaa kunttidi immo.

English Sentences: And I myself also am persuaded of you, my brethren, that ye also are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge, able also to admonish one another.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta ishatoo, inttenan lo77otettainne eratetta ubbai kumidoogaanne qassi issoi issuwaa zoranau danddayiyoogaa taani ta huuphen eraas.

English Sentences: Nevertheless, brethren, I have written the more boldly unto you in some sort, as putting you in mind, because of the grace that is given to me of God,
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin taani inttena issibaa issibaa gujja hassayissanau, ha dabddaabbiyaa giddon ainne yayyennan intteyyo xaafaas.

English Sentences: That I should be the minister of Jesus Christ to the Gentiles, ministering the gospel of God, that the offering up of the Gentiles might be acceptable, being sanctified by the Holy Ghost.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani Kiristtoos Yesuusa ashkkara gidada, Aihuda gidenna asau oottanaadan, Xoossai taayyo aaro kehatettaa immido gishshau, taani ainne yayyabeikke; Aihuda gidenna asai Geeshsha Ayyaanaa baggaara Xoossau geeshsha gididi, a ufaissiya yarshsho gidanaadan, Xoossaa wonggeliyaa mishiraachchuwaa yootiyoogan qeesedan oottais.

English Sentences: I have therefore whereof I may glory through Jesus Christ in those things which pertain to God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, taani Kiristtoos Yesuusan gidada Xoossau oottiyooban ceeqettanau danddayais.

English Sentences: For I will not dare to speak of any of those things which Christ hath not wrought by me, to make the Gentiles obedient, by word and deed,
Wolaitta Sentences: Aihuda gidenna asai Xoossau azazettanaadan, Kiristtoosi ta baggaara qaalan, oosuwan, malaataa wolqqan, Xoossai oottiyo malaataa wolqqaaninne Geeshsha Ayyaanaa wolqqan oottidoogaa xalaalaa taani yootanaappe attin, harabaa yootanau xalikke.

English Sentences: Through mighty signs and wonders, by the power of the Spirit of God; so that from Jerusalem, and round about unto Illyricum, I have fully preached the gospel of Christ.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Yerusalaameppe doommada, Iliwaariqoona giyo biittaa gakkanaassi yuuyada, Kiristtoosa wonggeliyaa mishiraachchuwaa wurssa yootaas.

English Sentences: Yea, so have I strived to preach the gospel, not where Christ was named, lest I should build upon another man's foundation:
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadankka, taani hara asi doommidoogaa bollan doommennaadan, Kiristtoosa sunttai xeesettibeennasan wonggeliyaa mishiraachchuwaa yootanau amottaas.

English Sentences: But as it is written, To whom he was not spoken of, they shall see: and they that have not heard shall understand.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Xoossaa maxaafai, "Abai odettibeennaageeti a be7ana; qassi abaa siyibeennaageeti akeekana" yaagees.

English Sentences: For which cause also I have been much hindered from coming to you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, taani darotoo inttekko yaanau koyaas; shin yaanau danddayabeikke.

English Sentences: But now having no more place in these parts, and having a great desire these many years to come unto you;
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin taani ha77i ha biittan ta oosuwaa wurssido gishshaunne daro laittaappe doommada inttena baada be7anau laamotido gishshau

English Sentences: Whensoever I take my journey into Spain, I will come to you: for I trust to see you in my journey, and to be brought on my way thitherward by you, if first I be somewhat filled with your company.
Wolaitta Sentences: ha77ikka inttekko baana yaagada qoppais; taani Isppeene giyo biittaa baidda inttena be7anau koyais; qassi amarida wodiyaa inttena be7ada ufaittoogaappe guyyiyan, Isppeene biishin, intte tana maaddana mala koyais.

English Sentences: But now I go unto Jerusalem to minister unto the saints.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin ha77i taani geeshshatuyyo oottanau, Yerusalaame bais.

English Sentences: For it hath pleased them of Macedonia and Achaia to make a certain contribution for the poor saints which are at Jerusalem.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, Maqidooniyaanne Akaayiyaa giyo biittatun de7iya woosa keettaa asati Yerusalaamen de7iya hiyyeesatussi miishsha immanau koyidosona.

English Sentences: It hath pleased them verily; and their debtors they are. For if the Gentiles have been made partakers of their spiritual things, their duty is also to minister unto them in carnal things.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti bantta huuphen hagaa oottanau qofaa qachchidosona. Eti he hiyyeesata maaddanaagee etau acoi de7ees; aissi giikko, Aihudati bantta ayyaanaa anjjuwaa Aihuda gidenna asatuura shaakkidabaa gidikko, Aihuda gidenna asatikka qassi banttau de7idaban Aihudata maaddanau bessees.

English Sentences: When therefore I have performed this, and have sealed to them this fruit, I will come by you into Spain.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, taani ha oosuwaa wurssidoogaappe guyyiyaaninne etau shiiqida miishshaa muleera immidoogaappe guyyiyan, Isppeene baana; baidda intte mataara aadhdhana.

English Sentences: And I am sure that, when I come unto you, I shall come in the fulness of the blessing of the gospel of Christ.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani inttekko biyo wode, Kiristtoosa anjjoi tanan kumin baanaagaa erais.

English Sentences: Now I beseech you, brethren, for the Lord Jesus Christ's sake, and for the love of the Spirit, that ye strive together with me in your prayers to God for me;
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta ishatoo, tau Xoossaa intte woossiiddi, woosan intte tanaara minnanaadan, Godaa Yesuus Kiristtoosa baggaaranne Geeshsha Ayyaanai immiyo siiqotettan taani inttena woossais.

English Sentences: That I may be delivered from them that do not believe in Judaea; and that my service which I have for Jerusalem may be accepted of the saints;
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani Yihudan de7iya ammanennaageetuppe attanaadaaninne qassi taani Yerusalaamen oottiyo oosoi yaani de7iya geeshshata ufaissiyaagaa gidanaadan, Xoossaa woossite.

English Sentences: That I may come unto you with joy by the will of God, and may with you be refreshed.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi Xoossai giikko, taani inttekko ufaissan baada, intte matan shemppana.

English Sentences: Now the God of peace be with you all. Amen.
Wolaitta Sentences: Sarotettaa Xoossai inttenaara ubbaara gido. Amin77i.

English Sentences: I commend unto you Phebe our sister, which is a servant of the church which is at Cenchrea:
Wolaitta Sentences: Kinkkiriyaa giyo kataman de7iya woosa keettan oottiya nu michchiyaa Peeba lo77o maccaasa gidiyoogaa taani inttena erissais.

English Sentences: That ye receive her in the Lord, as becometh saints, and that ye assist her in whatsoever business she hath need of you: for she hath been a succourer of many, and of myself also.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte o geeshshati Godaa sunttan mokkiyoogaadan mokkite; qassi a intteppe koyiyoobai aiba gidikkokka, o maaddite; aissi giikko, a ba huuphen daro asaa maaddaasu; qassi tana ta huuphenkka keehi maaddaasu.

English Sentences: Greet Priscilla and Aquila my helpers in Christ Jesus:
Wolaitta Sentences: Kiristtoos Yesuusa oosuwaa tanaara issippe oottiya PHirisqqiliyyoonne Aqiilayyo ta sarotaa yootite.

English Sentences: Who have for my life laid down their own necks: unto whom not only I give thanks, but also all the churches of the Gentiles.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti ta shemppuwaa gishshau, bantta shemppuwaa aatti immidosona. Eta ta xalaala gidennan, Aihuda gidenna asaa woosa keetta ubbaikka galatees.

English Sentences: Likewise greet the church that is in their house. Salute my well-beloved Epaenetus, who is the firstfruits of Achaia unto Christ.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi eta keettaa woosa keetta oottidi shiiqiya asaa ubbaa saro giite. Isiyaa biittan Kiristtoosa koiro ammanida Eppaneetosau, taani siiqiyoogau, ta sarotaa yootite.

English Sentences: Greet Mary, who bestowed much labour on us.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intteyyo keehi daafurida Mairaamo saro giite.

English Sentences: Salute Andronicus and Junia, my kinsmen, and my fellow-prisoners, who are of note among the apostles, who also were in Christ before me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tanaara qasho keettan de7ida ta dabbo Aihudata, Anddironiqoosanne Yuniyaasa saro giite. Yesuusi kiittidoogeetu giddon eti daro erettidaageeta. Qassi eti Kiristtoosa taappe kase ammanidosona.

English Sentences: Greet Amplias my beloved in the Lord.
Wolaitta Sentences: Godaara issippetettan de7iya ta siiqo laggiyaa Amppiliyatoosayyo ta sarotaa yootite.

English Sentences: Salute Urbane, our helper in Christ, and Stachys my beloved.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kiristtoosa oosuwaa nunaara issippe oottiya Urbbaanoosanne taani siiqiyo Isttakuusa saro giite.

English Sentences: Salute Apelles approved in Christ. Salute them which are of Aristobulus' household.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kiristtoosaara i de7iyoogee erettin galatettida Apheliisayyo ta sarotaa yootite; Arisxxobiloosa so asaukka ta sarotaa yootite.

English Sentences: Salute Herodion my kinsman. Greet them that be of the household of Narcissus, which are in the Lord.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta dabbo Heeroodiyoonanne Kiristtoosa ammaniya Narssiisasa so asaa saro giite.

English Sentences: Salute Tryphena and Tryphosa, who labour in the Lord. Salute the beloved Persis, which laboured much in the Lord.
Wolaitta Sentences: Godaa oosuwan daafuriya Tirufainanne Tirufoosa saro giite; qassi Godau daro daafurada oottiya siiqiyo Perssiiso saro giite.

English Sentences: Salute Rufus chosen in the Lord, and his mother and mine.
Wolaitta Sentences: Godaa oosuwan keehi erettida Rufoosayyoonne tana ba na7adan maaddida a aayeeyyo ta sarotaa yootite.

English Sentences: Salute Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermas, Patrobas, Hermes, and the brethren which are with them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta sarotaa Asinkkiriitoosayyo, Pileegoonayyo, Hermmeesayyo, Patirobaasayyoonne etaara de7iya ammaniya ishanttu ubbaayyo yootite.

English Sentences: Salute Philologus, and Julia, Nereus, and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints which are with them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Pileegoona, Yuulo, Neeriyaa, a michchiyo, Olumppoosanne etaara de7iya geeshshata ubbaa saro giite.

English Sentences: Salute one another with an holy kiss. The churches of Christ salute you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Geeshsha asayyo bessiya yeretaa yerettidi, issoi issuwaa sarotite; Kiristtoosa woosa keetta ubbati inttena saro yaagoosona.

English Sentences: Now I beseech you, brethren, mark them which cause divisions and offences contrary to the doctrine which ye have learned; and avoid them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta ishatoo, asaa giddon shaahotettaa medhdhiyaageeta, asaa ammanuwau xube gidiyaageetanne intte tamaarido timirttiyaara gaittennaagaa tamaarissiyaageeta akeekanaadan, taani inttena woossais. Etakko shiiqoppite.

English Sentences: For they that are such serve not our Lord Jesus Christ, but their own belly; and by good words and fair speeches deceive the hearts of the simple.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, hegaa malabaa oottiyaageeti bantta uluwau oottoosonappe attin, nu Godaa Yesuus Kiristtoosayyo oottokkona; bantta mal77iya haasayaaninne qiriyan iitabaa qoppenna asaa wozanaa balettoosona.

English Sentences: For your obedience is come abroad unto all men. I am glad therefore on your behalf: but yet I would have you wise unto that which is good, and simple concerning evil.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wonggeliyau intte azazettidoogaa asai ubbai siyiis. Hegaa gishshau, taani intteban ufaittais; shin lo77obau intte aadhdhida eranchcha gidanaadaaninne qassi iitabau ashkketa gidanaadan koyais.

English Sentences: And the God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.
Wolaitta Sentences: Sarotettaa Xoossai Seexaanaa intte tohuwaappe garssan haakkenna matan gaacci qolana. Nu Godaa Yesuus Kiristtoosa aaro kehatettai inttenaara gido.

English Sentences: Timotheus my workfellow, and Lucius, and Jason, and Sosipater, my kinsmen, salute you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tanaara oottiya Ximootiyoosi inttena saro yaagees; qassi hegaadankka, ta dabboti Luqiyoosi, Yaasooninne Sosiiphaaxiroosi inttena saro yaagoosona.

English Sentences: I Tertius, who wrote this epistle, salute you in the Lord.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani, Xarxxiyoosi, ha dabddaabbiyaa xaafidaagee, intteyyo Godaa sunttan sarotaa kiittais.

English Sentences: Gaius mine host, and of the whole church, saluteth you. Erastus the chamberlain of the city saluteth you, and Quartus a brother.
Wolaitta Sentences: Woosa keettaa asai ubbai a sooni shiiqiyo ta siiraa Gaayoosi inttena saro yaagees; katamaa miishshaa oiqqiya Erasxxoosinne nu ishai Quwarxxoosi inttena saro yaagoosona.

English Sentences: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nu Godaa Yesuus Kiristtoosa aaro kehatettai inttenaara ubbaara gido. Amin77i.
